column4: Hi guys! I'm trying to mount an external usb disk, lsusb sees it, but fdisk not. Do I lack any package installed? thank you!
also can you pastebin the relvent lines from lusb?
i can't issue e #mount /dev/??? because the disk isn't seen as a disk. sudo fdisk -l doesn't see it, ls /dev/disk/by-path doesn't see it
so what shows up in lusb? and what does dmesg print when you've plugged it in?
lsusb tells: "Bus 002 Device 003: ID 04b4:6830 Cypress Semiconductor Corp. USB-2.0 IDE Adapter"
and does anything show up when you run #dmesg?
do other dirves work ok? and do you get anything further in dmesg after a while (i.e. a couple of minutes)?
understood but that's not going through the USB controller is it... at the moment it looks like an issue with the module responsible for high speed usb2.0 functionality.
sorry - the bit of ubuntu that handles USB drives isn't working properly. You could try removing the uhci_hcd module and seeing if that makes a difference. You can always reenable it later
to remove run the following in a terminal: sudo modprobe -r ehic_hcd
and then reboot your machine. to re enable simply run sudo modprobe ehic_hcd and then reboot
